org.apache.juneau.xml

Class XmlSchemaSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Lockable
      • org.apache.juneau.CoreApi
        • org.apache.juneau.serializer.Serializer
          • org.apache.juneau.serializer.WriterSerializer
            • org.apache.juneau.xml.XmlSerializer
              • org.apache.juneau.xml.XmlSchemaSerializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    XmlSchemaDocSerializer

    @Produces(value="text/xml+schema",
          contentType="text/xml")
public class XmlSchemaSerializer
extends XmlSerializer
    Serializes POJO metadata to HTTP responses as XML.
    Media types:

    Handles Accept types: text/xml+schema

    Produces Content-Type types: text/xml

    Description:

    Produces the XML-schema representation of the XML produced by the XmlSerializer class with the same properties.

    Configurable properties:

    This class has the following properties associated with it:

    • XmlSerializerContext
    • BeanContext

    • Method Detail

      • doSerialize

        protected void doSerialize(SerializerSession session,
                           Object o)
                    throws Exception
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Serializes a POJO to the specified output stream or writer.

        This method should NOT close the context object.

        Overrides:
        doSerialize in class XmlSerializer
        Parameters:
        session - The serializer session object return by Serializer.createSession(Object, ObjectMap, Method, Locale, TimeZone, MediaType).
        If null, session is created using Serializer.createSession(Object).
        o - The object to serialize.
        Throws:
        Exception - If thrown from underlying stream, or if the input contains a syntax error or is malformed.

      • getValidator

        public Validator getValidator(SerializerSession session,
                              Object o)
                       throws Exception
        Returns an XML-Schema validator based on the output returned by doSerialize(SerializerSession, Object);
        Parameters:
        session - The serializer session object return by createSession(Object, ObjectMap, Method, Locale, TimeZone, MediaType).
        Can be null.
        o - The object to serialize.
        Returns:
        The new validator.
        Throws:
        Exception - If a problem was detected in the XML-Schema output produced by this serializer.

      • createSession

        public XmlSerializerSession createSession(Object output,
                                          ObjectMap op,
                                          Method javaMethod,
                                          Locale locale,
                                          TimeZone timeZone,
                                          MediaType mediaType)
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Create the session object that will be passed in to the serialize method.

        It's up to implementers to decide what the session object looks like, although typically it's going to be a subclass of SerializerSession.

        Overrides:
        createSession in class XmlSerializer
        Parameters:
        output - The output object.
        Character-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
        • Writer
        • OutputStream - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
        • File - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.

        Stream-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
        • OutputStream
        • File
        op - Optional additional properties.
        javaMethod - Java method that invoked this serializer. When using the REST API, this is the Java method invoked by the REST call. Can be used to access annotations defined on the method or class.
        locale - The session locale. If null, then the locale defined on the context is used.
        timeZone - The session timezone. If null, then the timezone defined on the context is used.
        mediaType - The session media type (e.g. "application/json").
        Returns:
        The new session.
